primary_impacts: Innovation output declining after record highs
Samsung leading with 7,054 grants (+11% YoY) -- East Asian dominance
Cell-related technology surging +23% over 4 years
signals.rationale: US patent applications decline 9% while cell-related technology surges 23%. Samsung leads with 7,054 grants -- innovation geography shifting.

signals.title: ILO: Global Jobs Gap Reaches 408 Million in 2026 Despite Stable Unemployment
primary_impacts: 408M global jobs gap exposes failure of standard unemployment metric
2.1B workers in informal economy without protection -- systemic vulnerability
Gender gap: women 24.2% less likely in labor force
signals.rationale: ILO flagship report reveals 408M global jobs gap beyond headline unemployment. 2.1B workers in informal economy, 260M NEET youth -- structural social vulnerability at scale.

signals.title: Climate Models Missing Key Ocean Player: Plankton Shallow Dissolution Underestimated
primary_impacts: Systematic bias in climate projections if plankton dissolution omitted
Carbon cycle budget calculations potentially incorrect
Ocean chemistry understanding fundamentally incomplete
signals.rationale: Climate models systematically underrepresent plankton shallow dissolution -- potentially skewing carbon cycle projections and climate policy targets.

signals.title: FDA Clears First Human Trial of Epigenetic Reprogramming Anti-Aging Therapy
primary_impacts: First-ever human clinical trial of anti-aging gene therapy using Yamanaka factors
Potential to reverse age-related cellular damage (not just slow aging)
Regulatory pathway established for rejuvenation therapies
signals.rationale: First human clinical trial of anti-aging therapy using Yamanaka factors (OSK). Historic translation from lab to patient of partial cellular rejuvenation.

signals.title: Deep-Sea Chiton Named by Public Vote: 8,000 Submissions for Rare Species
primary_impacts: Citizen science engagement growing -- 8,000 naming submissions
Science communication democratization via social media (YouTube)
Public awareness of deep-sea biodiversity increasing
signals.rationale: 8,000 public naming submissions for deep-sea chiton signals growing citizen science engagement and science-society relationship evolution.

signals.title: NASA Perseverance Achieves AI-Driven Autonomous Navigation: 450m Without Human Input
primary_impacts: AI-generated waypoints reduce Earth-Mars communication dependency
450m autonomous drive demonstrates practical AI-rover integration
Template for future autonomous exploration (lunar, asteroid)
signals.rationale: AI-generated waypoints for Mars rover -- 450m autonomous drive reduces Earth-Mars communication dependency. Template for future autonomous planetary exploration.

signals.title: Anthropic closes in on $20B round at $350B valuation

content.abstract: Anthropic is in the final stages of raising $20 billion in new capital at a valuation of $350 billion, with investor demand leading the company to raise twice the funding it set out to obtain. The AI safety company's massive round signals continued explosive growth in foundational AI investment.

signals.title: Runway AI video startup raises $315M at $5.3B valuation for world models

content.abstract: AI video-generation startup Runway has raised a $315 million Series E round, nearly doubling its valuation to $5.3 billion. The fresh funds will allow Runway to pre-train the next generation of world models, signaling the rapid maturation of generative AI in visual content creation.

signals.title: Modal Labs AI inference startup in talks to raise at $2.5B valuation

content.abstract: Modal Labs, specializing in AI inference infrastructure, is in talks to raise at a valuation of about $2.5 billion, more than doubling from $1.1 billion less than five months ago. AI inference infrastructure is becoming a critical bottleneck as deployed AI models scale.

signals.title: Cisco launches breakthrough innovations for the AI era including Silicon One G300

content.abstract: At Cisco Live Conference in Amsterdam, Cisco unveiled Silicon One G300 102.4 Tbps switching silicon, offering 33% increase in network utilization and 28% improvement in job completion time for AI workloads. This addresses critical AI infrastructure bottlenecks.

signals.title: MIT Technology Review 10 Breakthrough Technologies 2026: Sodium-ion batteries

content.abstract: Sodium-ion batteries made from abundant materials like salt emerge as cheaper, safer alternative to lithium-ion for grid-scale storage and affordable EVs. This could reshape the energy storage market by reducing reliance on scarce lithium resources.

signals.title: Mechanistic interpretability: Understanding what AI models actually know

content.abstract: Mechanistic interpretability aims to map key features and pathways across entire AI models. Anthropic built a microscope to peer inside its Claude model, tracing model reasoning from prompt to response. This breakthrough addresses the black box problem in AI governance.

signals.title: Personalized gene-editing treatments: Baby KJ becomes first recipient

content.abstract: Baby KJ became the first person to receive a personalized gene-editing treatment. Clinical trials are now planned, with bespoke gene-editing drugs potentially approved within the next few years. This represents a paradigm shift in precision medicine.

signals.title: H-1B visa weighted selection rule replacing random lottery effective February 27

content.abstract: DHS released final H-1B weighted selection rule replacing the random lottery with a wage-weighted system, effective February 27, 2026. Higher-wage positions receive priority in the selection process, fundamentally changing skilled immigration pathways.

signals.title: H-2B visa program: 64,716 additional visas authorized for FY2026

content.abstract: DHS authorized up to 64,716 additional H-2B temporary nonagricultural worker visas for American businesses suffering impending irreparable harm, distributed in three allocations based on employment start dates through fiscal year end.

signals.title: WHO pandemic preparedness: Six years after COVID-19 assessment

content.abstract: WHO's assessment six years after COVID-19 PHEIC declaration finds the world is better prepared in many ways but progress is fragile and uneven. Meaningful steps have been taken to strengthen preparedness, but more needs to be done.

signals.title: WHO launches $1 billion 2026 appeal for 36 emergencies worldwide

content.abstract: WHO launched its 2026 appeal seeking nearly US$1 billion to respond to 36 emergencies worldwide, including 14 Grade 3 emergencies requiring the highest organizational response. Growing number of emergencies strains global health system.

signals.title: Global health systems at risk as international funding cuts intensify

content.abstract: WHO warned that cuts to international aid and persistent funding gaps are undermining the global health system, as the risk from pandemics, drug-resistant infections and fragile health services are on the rise.

signals.title: Trump EPA revokes CO2 endangerment finding — largest deregulation in US history

content.abstract: EPA Administrator Lee Zeldin finalized the rescission of the 2009 endangerment finding that determined greenhouse gases endanger public health. Called the 'single largest act of deregulation in US history,' this eliminates the central legal basis for federal climate action, including vehicle emissions rules.

signals.title: China's clean energy drove one-third of economic growth in 2025

content.abstract: Solar power, EVs, and other clean-energy technologies drove more than a third of China's economic growth in 2025. Clean-energy sectors contributed a record 15.4 trillion yuan ($2.1 trillion), or 11.4% of China's GDP, demonstrating the economic viability of green transition.

signals.title: Greenland records warmest January on record: 4x faster warming than global average

content.abstract: Greenland recorded its warmest January on record with average temperatures in Nuuk reaching +0.2C compared to the 1991-2020 average of -7.7C. Climate researchers note Greenland is warming about four times faster than the global average, accelerating ice sheet melt.

signals.title: UN declares dawn of global water bankruptcy amid chronic groundwater depletion

content.abstract: A UN report declared the dawn of an era of global water bankruptcy amid chronic groundwater depletion, water overallocation, land degradation, deforestation, and pollution compounded by global heating. This represents a critical sustainability threshold.

signals.title: Neuralink Blindsight brain implant to begin human testing for vision restoration in 2026

content.abstract: Neuralink plans to test its newest and most powerful brain-computer interface implant, Blindsight, aimed at restoring partial sight to fully blind patients. This represents a major milestone in direct neural interface technology for sensory restoration.

signals.title: First deuterium-tritium fusion fuel cycle demonstration planned for late 2026

content.abstract: The first-ever project to demonstrate the deuterium-tritium fuel cycle — the most viable route to practical fusion energy — plans to be operational by late 2026. This milestone could accelerate the timeline for commercial fusion power.

signals.title: Tensor to release SAE Level 4 autonomous vehicle to consumers in H2 2026

content.abstract: Automotive startup Tensor plans to release its SAE Level 4 car to consumers in H2 2026 — the car can safely travel without a person in the driver's seat. This represents a significant leap toward full autonomous driving commercialization.

signals.title: OECD projects global GDP growth cooling to 2.9% in 2026 amid fragilities

content.abstract: Global GDP growth is projected to ease from 3.2% in 2025 to 2.9% in 2026. Labour markets show first signs of weakening despite OECD unemployment steady at 4.9%. Key risks include further trade barriers and sharp repricing in financial markets.

signals.title: IMF: Global growth steady at 3.3% but risks tilted to downside

content.abstract: IMF projects global growth at 3.3% for 2026, revised slightly up but risks remain tilted to downside including renewed trade frictions, tighter financial conditions, elevated fiscal vulnerabilities, rising geopolitical tensions, and climate shocks.

signals.title: Global economy slows to 2.7% growth as trade tensions and fiscal strains intensify

content.abstract: UNCTAD World Economic Situation and Prospects 2026 projects global economy slowing to 2.7%, below 2025 levels and pre-pandemic average. Digital services account for 62% of services sold but least developed countries hold just 0.16% of global digital services trade.

signals.title: Geoeconomic confrontation identified as world's top threat by global leaders

content.abstract: 18% of surveyed global leaders identified geoeconomic confrontation — use of trade, investment, sanctions, and industrial policy as strategic weapons — as the most likely trigger of a global crisis. Governments increasingly pursue economic sovereignty through de-risking and onshoring.

signals.title: Last US-Russia nuclear arms control treaty set to expire amid rising tensions

content.abstract: The last remaining arms control treaty limiting nuclear weapons between the US and Russia is set to expire, coinciding with intensified infrastructure attacks in the Ukraine war and Middle East instability with six conflicts involving Israel.

signals.title: EU AI Act implementation delayed: Digital Omnibus defers high-risk obligations to December 2027

content.abstract: European Commission's Digital Omnibus package proposes delaying EU AI Act high-risk system obligations by up to 16 months to December 2027. The delay is part of the EU's simplification agenda amid growing US-EU tensions over AI regulation approaches.

signals.title: Americans' views of economy remain negative one year into Trump's second term

content.abstract: Most Americans continue to hold negative views of the US economy, as has been the case for the last six years, despite economic indicators. This persistent sentiment gap signals potential social and political instability.

signals.title: Protein DMTF1 identified for rejuvenating aging brain cells and neural regeneration

content.abstract: A newly identified protein DMTF1 may hold the key to rejuvenating aging brain cells. Boosting this protein can restore the ability of neural stem cells to regenerate even when age-related damage has set in, opening new pathways for neurodegenerative disease treatment.

signals.title: Menopause linked to significant changes in brain structure, mental health, and sleep

content.abstract: A major study reveals menopause is linked to changes in brain structure, mental health, and sleep patterns. Brain scans revealed grey matter loss in areas tied to memory and emotional regulation, with significant implications for women's health policy.

signals.title: Over half of world's coral reefs damaged: $9.8 trillion annual ecosystem value at risk

content.abstract: More than half of the world's coral reefs suffered damage during marine heatwaves. Coral reefs, worth an estimated $9.8 trillion per year to humanity, face existential threat from ocean warming, with cascading impacts on marine biodiversity and coastal economies.

signals.title: NVIDIA Rubin extreme-codesigned AI platform enters full production at CES 2026

content.abstract: NVIDIA unveiled Rubin, its first extreme-codesigned six-chip AI platform now in full production, along with Alpamayo open reasoning model for autonomous vehicle development. This signals the next generation of AI hardware scaling.

signals.title: North Korea UNC2970 using Google Gemini AI for cyber reconnaissance and OSINT

content.abstract: Google observed North Korea-linked threat actor UNC2970 using generative AI model Gemini to conduct reconnaissance, synthesize OSINT, and profile high-value targets to support campaign planning. This represents a new dimension of AI-powered state-sponsored cyber warfare.

signals.title: Passwordless authentication reaches inflection point: Apple, Google, Microsoft push passkeys

content.abstract: The push to eliminate passwords reaches an inflection point in 2026 with widespread adoption of passkeys backed by Apple, Google, and Microsoft, making passwordless MFA the default user experience. AI-driven identity governance becomes standard.

signals.title: US patent applications decrease 9% after reaching record high; Asia holds 60% of global patents

content.abstract: US patent applications decreased dramatically by 9% one year after reaching record high. Meanwhile, Asia now accounts for 60% of global patent filings, up from 48% in 2016, signaling a long-term shift in innovation geography from West to East.

signals.title: Brain-computer interface patents surge: Neuralink, Synchron, Blackrock Neurotech lead

content.abstract: BCI patent activity surges with clinical progress from Neuralink, Synchron, Blackrock Neurotech, and Paradromics advancing implantable devices for speech restoration, motor control, and neuroprosthetics. BCIs are transforming neurotechnology.

signals.title: IBM: 2026 marks first time quantum computer outperforms classical computer

content.abstract: IBM has publicly stated that 2026 will mark the first time a quantum computer will be able to outperform a classical computer. Silicon Quantum Computing demonstrated an 11-qubit atom processor with gate fidelities up to 99.99%.

signals.title: Infleqtion achieves 99.93% neutral-atom qubit readout fidelity for quantum error correction

content.abstract: Infleqtion and University of Wisconsin-Madison achieved record-breaking 99.93% readout fidelity for neutral-atom qubits, providing a path to fast mid-circuit measurements required for quantum error correction — a critical milestone for practical quantum computing.

signals.title: All-EV marketplace Ever secures $31M Series A backed by Eclipse

content.abstract: Ever secured $31M Series A for its all-EV marketplace, backed by Eclipse, Ibex Investors, Lifeline Ventures, and JIMCO (Saudi Jameel family). Platform model for EV sales signals growing maturity of the electric vehicle secondary market.

signals.title: Amsterdam and Florence ban fossil fuel and meat advertisements

content.abstract: Amsterdam's city council passed a legally binding ban on ads for fossil fuels and meat products, becoming the first capital city to fully prohibit such ads. Florence also approved similar bans. This signals growing municipal-level climate governance.

signals.title: Science Based Targets initiative validates climate targets for 10,000 companies

content.abstract: SBTi has now validated climate targets for 10,000 companies worldwide. Microsoft signed a 12-year deal for 2.85 million tonnes of carbon removals, while Salesforce backed $5 million in early-stage purchases across 19 suppliers.

signals.title: Swedish youth file landmark legal challenge against government climate targets

content.abstract: Young activists launched a high-stakes legal challenge against the Swedish government, alleging climate targets violate international law. The Aurora organization argues Sweden is not doing its 'fair share' to limit warming to 1.5C, building on global climate litigation trend.

signals.title: Precision genome editing with CRISPR advancing xenotransplantation outcomes

content.abstract: CRISPR-Cas9 genome editing is eliminating sources of rejection in xenotransplantation. Combined with next-generation immunosuppressants, patient outcomes are dramatically improving, opening the door to animal-to-human organ transplants at scale.

signals.title: MIT develops robot 'Relevance' framework: 90% accuracy predicting human intent

content.abstract: MIT researchers developed a 'Relevance' framework allowing robots to filter sensory data and identify objects most pertinent to human objectives, achieving up to 90% accuracy in predicting human intent. This advances human-robot collaboration significantly.

signals.title: Demographic workforce crisis: US-born labor force projected to shrink over next decade

content.abstract: The US-born labor force will shrink over the next decade, making historically normal GDP growth rates impossible unless immigration flows are sustained. Workers age 55+ now represent 24% of the US workforce, up from 10% in 1994.

signals.title: WIPO Innovation Capabilities Outlook 2026: Global innovation geography shifting

content.abstract: WIPO's Innovation Capabilities Outlook 2026 reveals shifting global innovation geography with Asia commanding 60% of global patent filings. Physical AI, robotics, and BCI emerge as fastest-growing patent domains.

signals.title: WHO Pandemic Agreement IGWG meeting: Pathogen access and benefit sharing negotiations

content.abstract: Intergovernmental Working Group meeting on WHO Pandemic Agreement held February 9-14, 2026, focusing on pathogen access and benefit sharing system negotiations. Countries aim to accelerate progress on global pandemic preparedness framework.

signals.title: Maine Lakes: Shorter Ice Seasons Signal Water Quality Crisis and Cultural Loss

content.abstract: Maine lakes are experiencing dramatically shorter ice seasons due to climate change, with direct impacts on water quality and loss of winter recreational traditions. Shorter ice cover periods allow more algal blooms, threatening drinking water supplies and ecosystem health. The cultural dimension of ice skating and winter lake traditions adds a social dimension to the environmental impact.

signals.title: NYC Chief Climate Officer Signals Urban Climate Governance Paradigm Shift

content.abstract: New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani appoints Louise Yeung as chief climate officer, signaling a shift toward integrating climate resilience into all city operations. Yeung brings decade of experience in flood infrastructure, climate-resilient tunnels, and aligning financial investments with climate goals. This appointment represents a broader trend of cities creating dedicated executive-level climate positions.

signals.title: Environmental Reporting Must Outlast the News Cycle: Africa Biodiversity Journalism Gap

content.abstract: In parts of Africa most affected by biodiversity loss and climate stress, slow-moving ecological change, fragmented governance, and contested evidence make it difficult to translate environmental signals into journalism that travels beyond borders. The signals are often local, technical, and politically inconvenient, yet they shape global understanding of environmental futures.

signals.title: Storm Nils: Deadly Floods in France as Extreme Weather Events Accelerate

content.abstract: Storm Nils caused 2 deaths in France with continued flooding in the southwest. Government spokesperson confirmed the casualties and ongoing flood alerts. The storm represents the increasing frequency and severity of extreme weather events in Western Europe, consistent with climate change projections for the region.

signals.title: AAP Challenges Kennedy HHS Unlawful Vaccine Policy Changes in Federal Court

content.abstract: The American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) argued in a packed Boston federal courtroom that Robert F. Kennedy Jr.s HHS made unlawful changes to vaccine advisory committee (ACIP) policies. The judge did not rule from the bench, indicating the significance and complexity of the case. This represents a major institutional conflict between medical establishment and political appointees over public health governance.

signals.title: FDA Rejects Disc Medicine Rare Disease Therapy: Regulatory Scrutiny Signal

content.abstract: The FDA rejected a rare disease therapy from Disc Medicine, an early recipient of the commissioners priority review voucher. This decision signals continued regulatory caution in the rare disease therapeutic space despite expedited review pathways, with implications for biotechnology investment and patient access.

signals.title: AgriFoodTech Trends 2026: AI Reshaping Entire Food System Innovation Pipeline

content.abstract: DigitalFoodLabs annual FoodTech trends report and webinar highlights how AI is shifting from experimental add-on to essential infrastructure in the food system, reshaping how the entire industry thinks, reacts, and innovates. Key trends include digital tools expanding food safety adoption, regulatory pressures reshaping the innovation pipeline, and AI moving from pilot to practice across agriculture and food production.

signals.title: Food Industry Losing Control of Its Future: 4 Warning Signals

content.abstract: Four uncomfortable data signals suggest the food industry may be losing control of its future trajectory. The analysis covers diverse topics including market share shifts, technology adoption gaps, regulatory pressure, and changing consumer behavior that together paint a picture of an industry at an inflection point.

signals.title: WHO Pandemic Agreement Annex Negotiation Progress

content.abstract: Member States concluded weeklong PABS annex negotiations for the WHO Pandemic Agreement, covering pathogen access and benefit sharing. 2026 appeal seeks $1B for 36 emergencies including 14 Grade 3 emergencies.

signals.title: Amazon Halts Blue Jay Warehouse Robotics Project

content.abstract: Amazon halted its Blue Jay warehouse robotics project after less than six months. The multi-armed robot designed for package sorting in same-day delivery facilities. Core technology redirected to other manipulation programs.

signals.title: Figure Fintech Data Breach Affects ~1M Customers

content.abstract: Blockchain-based lending giant Figure suffered data breach affecting 967,200 unique email addresses. Breach data analyzed by Troy Hunt of Have I Been Pwned.

signals.title: EU Countervailing Duty Amendment on Chinese EVs

content.abstract: Commission Implementing Regulation 2026/330 amends countervailing duties on new battery electric vehicles from China following partial interim review. Signals continued EU-China trade friction in green tech.

signals.title: New START Treaty Expiration Risk — Nuclear Arms Control Gap

content.abstract: The last remaining US-Russia nuclear arms control treaty (New START) set to expire in February 2026, creating unprecedented gap in bilateral nuclear weapons limitations. No successor agreement in sight.

signals.title: Microsoft-Atom Computing Deliver First Error-Corrected Quantum Computer

content.abstract: Microsoft and Atom Computing plan to deliver error-corrected quantum computer to Denmark's Export & Investment Fund and Novo Nordisk Foundation. First level-two quantum computer available to customers.

signals.title: Neuralink Brain Chip Aims to Restore Sight to Blind

content.abstract: Neuralink's brain-computer interface chip targets vision restoration for blind individuals. Among 11 breakthrough technologies expected in 2026 according to IEEE Spectrum.

signals.title: Tensor Announces SAE Level 4 Consumer Autonomous Vehicle

content.abstract: Automotive startup Tensor plans to release SAE Level 4 autonomous car to consumers in H2 2026 — no human driver needed. First consumer-facing Level 4 vehicle.

signals.title: Deuterium-Tritium Fusion Fuel Cycle Demonstration Project

content.abstract: First-ever project to demonstrate deuterium-tritium fuel cycle — the most viable route to practical fusion energy — plans operational by late 2026.

signals.title: International AI Safety Report 2026 Published

content.abstract: Second International AI Safety Report published February 2026, comprehensive review of general-purpose AI capabilities and risks. Covers algorithmic bias, privacy, deepfakes, environmental impacts, job displacement.

signals.title: CRISPR Breakthrough: Gene Activation Without DNA Cutting

content.abstract: Scientists developed method to turn genes back on without cutting DNA by removing chemical tags. Gentler gene editing for sickle cell disease by reactivating fetal blood gene. Fewer unintended side effects.

signals.title: Sudan Crisis: UNHCR Appeals $1.6B for Displacement

content.abstract: As Sudan war approaches 4th year, UNHCR and 123 partners appeal for $1.6B to support millions fleeing. Combined with Libya systematic human rights violations report. 52 dead from Cyclone Gezani in Madagascar.

signals.title: Greenland Records Warmest January Ever — 4x Faster Warming

content.abstract: Greenland recorded warmest January on record: average Nuuk temperature +0.2°C vs 1991-2020 average -7.7°C. Greenland warming ~4x faster than global average. Arctic amplification accelerating.

signals.title: Amsterdam and Florence Ban Fossil Fuel Advertisements

content.abstract: Amsterdam becomes first capital city to fully prohibit fossil fuel advertisements via legally binding ban. Florence follows suit. Growing movement of cities banning fossil fuel advertising.

signals.title: HBM Scarcity: Bottleneck in AI Supply Chain

content.abstract: High-bandwidth memory (HBM) is the scarcest component in AI supply chain. AI accelerators consuming outsized share of advanced packaging capacity and premium memory output. Critical constraint on AI scaling.

signals.title: Cohere Releases Open Multilingual AI Models for Edge Devices

content.abstract: Cohere released new family of open multilingual models small enough to run on everyday devices. Targets cheaper deployment, easier control, viable in regions with connectivity/cloud cost constraints.

signals.title: OECD: Global Growth Slowing to 2.9% in 2026

content.abstract: Global growth projected to slow from 3.2% (2025) to 2.9% (2026). US GDP growth declining 2.0% to 1.7%. Labour markets weakening, job vacancies below 2019 average. Risk: trade barriers, AI investment returns, inflation.

signals.title: Qualcomm UK Lawsuit Challenges Chip Licensing Model

content.abstract: Qualcomm faces UK lawsuit challenging how it licenses key cellular technologies. Spotlight on royalty model underpinning smartphone and connected-device economy.

signals.title: Hong Kong HKMA Fintech 2030 Blueprint: Quantum and AI Focus

content.abstract: Hong Kong Monetary Authority published Fintech Promotion Blueprint including Quantum Preparedness Index for post-quantum cryptography migration. Major escalation from 2023 roadmap.

signals.title: Iceberg Quantum Breaks RSA-2048 with <100K Qubits

content.abstract: Iceberg Quantum's Pinnacle Architecture broke RSA-2048 with under 100,000 physical qubits via QLDPC codes — 10x reduction. QuTech demonstrated first Majorana qubit readout; 1,058 spin qubits at 2M/mm². Nature confirms quantum computers usable within a decade.

signals.title: US Federal Register: Clean Coal Executive Order & Libya Emergency

content.abstract: Executive Order 14386 on 'Strengthening US National Defense With Clean Coal Power Generation Fleet'. Continuation of national emergency re: Libya. FCC open commission meeting.

signals.title: India Budget: $2.2B for Carbon Capture and Renewables

content.abstract: India's 2026 budget includes ~$2.2B in new funding for carbon capture, utilization and storage, alongside support for renewable energy and critical minerals. Major climate investment signal from developing world's largest emitter.

signals.title: Swedish Youth Climate Lawsuit: Aurora vs Government

content.abstract: Youth-led organization Aurora launched legal challenge against Swedish government, alleging climate targets are inadequate and Sweden not doing 'fair share' to limit warming to 1.5°C.

signals.title: Pew: 64% of US Teens Use AI Chatbots, 30% Daily

content.abstract: 64% of US teens use AI chatbots, ~30% daily. 1-in-5 teens on TikTok/YouTube almost constantly. Americans show complicated relationship with news. Record 23M Asian Americans, projected 46M by 2060.

signals.title: UNCTAD: World Output Slowing to 2.7% — Below Pre-Pandemic Average

content.abstract: World output projected to slow to 2.7% in 2026, below pre-pandemic average of 3.2%. Insufficient for pandemic-era recovery or adequate job creation. Sub-Saharan Africa: 4.3% but insufficient for poverty reduction.

signals.title: WEF Global Cooperation Barometer 2026: Cooperation Weakening

content.abstract: WEF Global Cooperation Barometer 2026 shows cooperation weakening in key areas while being reconfigured in response to shifting economic, political and technological realities.

signals.title: Mass-Produced NK Cancer Cells via Cord Blood Stem Cell Engineering

content.abstract: Chinese scientists unveil breakthrough to mass-produce NK cancer-fighting immune cells by engineering early-stage stem cells from cord blood. Streamlined process generates enormous numbers of highly potent NK cells.

signals.title: CRISPR Tool for Antibiotic Resistance Crisis — UC San Diego

content.abstract: UC San Diego scientists unveil powerful new CRISPR-based tool addressing antibiotic resistance crisis. New approach to combat one of world's most pressing health threats.

signals.title: International Ocean Treaty Enters Force — Marine Life Protection

content.abstract: International agreement to protect and sustainably use marine life in international waters and international seabed enters into force. Major step in ocean ecosystem health.

signals.title: Colorado AI Act: Algorithmic Discrimination Requirements

content.abstract: Colorado AI Act establishes requirements for developers and deployers of high-risk AI systems including risk management, disclosures, and mitigation of algorithmic discrimination. February 2026 implementation deadline for impact assessments.

signals.title: MIT Scientists Trace Oxygen-Processing Enzyme Back Hundreds of Millions of Years

content.abstract: MIT researchers traced key oxygen-processing enzyme back hundreds of millions of years before oxygen filled atmosphere. Life may have learned to breathe oxygen long before Great Oxidation Event.

signals.title: Species Turnover Slowed by One-Third Since 1970s Due to Warming

content.abstract: As planet warms, species turnover has slowed by about one-third since the 1970s. Ecosystem dynamics changing in fundamental ways due to climate change.

signals.title: Apple Teases March 4 Global Synchronized Product Launch

content.abstract: Apple teases March 4 'special Apple experience' with events in New York, London, Shanghai simultaneously. Global synchronized launch strategy shift.

signals.title: Toxic Metals Moving from Contaminated Soil into Edible Crops — Brazil

content.abstract: Research from 2015 Brazil mining disaster: toxic metals (lead, cadmium) moving from contaminated earth into edible plants — bananas, cassava, cocoa found to absorb dangerous elements.

signals.title: Quantum Key Distribution: Ultra-Secure Communication Systems

content.abstract: Quantum key distribution promises ultra-secure communication by using quantum physics rules to detect eavesdroppers instantly. Critical for post-quantum cybersecurity.

signals.title: Global Health Systems 'At Risk' as Funding Cuts Bite — WHO

content.abstract: WHO warns global health systems at risk as funding cuts bite. DG Tedros says 2025 was 'one of most difficult years' in WHO history. Workforce reductions due to persistent funding gaps undermining response capacity.

signals.title: Nature Confirms 'Vibe Shift': Usable Quantum Computers Within a Decade

content.abstract: Nature February 2026 confirms researcher consensus shift: usable quantum computers achievable within a decade, not decades. Financial services emerging as primary proving ground. Early adopters report 15% increase in fraud detection.

signals.title: Ukraine: Russia Attacks on Energy Infrastructure Near 4-Year Mark

content.abstract: Civilian suffering continues in Ukraine as Russia's full-scale invasion approaches 4-year mark. Attacks on energy infrastructure causing blackouts and freezing conditions.

signals.title: Pew: What Makes People Proud of Their Country — Global Study

content.abstract: Pew Research (Feb 17) examines global national pride patterns — culture/lifestyle, politics/economy, people/diversity. Americans' complicated relationship with news; age divide in news consumption.

signals.title: Two-Thirds of Maternal Deaths in Conflict/Fragile States — WHO

content.abstract: Nearly two-thirds of all maternal deaths worldwide occur in countries marked by conflict or fragility. WHO report highlights intersection of conflict and reproductive health.

signals.title: Banks Report 15% Fraud Detection Improvement via Quantum-Classical Hybrid Systems

content.abstract: Major banks integrating quantum-classical hybrid systems for fraud detection. Early adopters report 15% accuracy increase and significant reduction in false positives. Financial services as quantum proving ground.

signals.title: Global Trade Realignment Without US — New Trade Deals

content.abstract: New trade deals show global economy realigning without US. Dollar substitute search accelerating. Brookings fellow warns long-term implications for US economic and geopolitical advantages.

signals.title: Denmark Ranks #1 in Climate Action; Offshore Energy Leadership

content.abstract: Denmark ranks as top-rated country for climate action in Climate Change Performance Index. Among only three countries achieving very high rating in renewable energies. Offshore energy leadership.

signals.title: 125-Million-Year-Old Dinosaur with Fossilized Skin Discovered in China

content.abstract: Chinese scientists uncovered exceptionally preserved juvenile iguanodontian with fossilized skin from 125 million years ago. Rewrites understanding of prehistoric life preservation.

signals.title: US Executive Order: Clean Coal for National Defense

content.abstract: Executive Order 14386 'Strengthening US National Defense With America's Beautiful Clean Coal Power Generation Fleet'. Signals policy reversal on coal phase-out, framing coal as defense infrastructure.

signals.title: Fed Vice Chair: Supply-Side Disinflation Dynamics Speech at Brookings

content.abstract: Federal Reserve Vice Chair Philip Jefferson spoke at Brookings on economic outlook and supply-side disinflation dynamics. Signals continuing data-dependent monetary easing approach.

signals.title: Firefighting Drones and eVTOL Air Taxis Among 2026 Tech Deployments

content.abstract: 2026 tech deployments include firefighting drones, eVTOL air taxis, CO2 bubble batteries, and ultrasound cancer treatment. Multiple convergent technologies reaching deployment stage.
